'''Louis IV of Legnica''' ({{langx|pl|Ludwik}}; [[Brzeg]], 19 April 1616 – [[Legnica]], 24 November 1663) was a duke of Brzeg from 1633 (together with his brothers until 1654), of [[Wołów]] (during 1653–1654 with his brothers) and of Legnica from 1653 (until 1654 with his brothers, after this alone).


He was the fifth but second surviving son of [[John Christian of Brieg|John Christian]], Duke of [[Brzeg]]-[[Legnica]]-[[Wołów]]-[[Oława]], by his first wife, [[Dorothea Sibylle of Brandenburg|Dorothea Sibylle]], daughter of [[John George, Elector of Brandenburg]].

source_payload.html:
Removing an individual incident of only trivial relevance

← Previous revision Revision as of 14:28, 6 February 2026
Line 17: Line 17:
According to Jack Lightbourn, former Executive Vice President of the Bank of Bermuda, the general managers of the two banks in Bermuda, [[HSBC Bank Bermuda|The Bank of Bermuda Ltd]] and [[Butterfield Bank|The Bank of N.T. Butterfield and Sons Ltd]]{{Clarify|date=March 2010}} were concerned that their male employees would not have suitable clothing to wear due to clothing shortages related to [[World War II]]. They arranged for a local tailor to make two pairs of shorts, modeled on the shorts of the British military, for each of their male employees. The shorts were made from a very itchy grey flannel material, and each employee was supplied with two pairs of heavy grey wool long socks to wear with the shorts. This was the beginning of Bermuda shorts as business attire in Bermuda as well as the pairing of long socks with Bermuda shorts.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.limeyinbermuda.com/latest_news/2005/08/shorting_the_sh.html |title=A Limey in Bermuda: Shorting the Shorts |access-date=2009-12-08 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091213095500/http://www.limeyinbermuda.com/latest_news/2005/08/shorting_the_sh.html |archive-date=2009-12-13 }}</ref> In the post-war period local merchants such as Trimingham Bros. and H.A. & E. Smiths improved the design of the shorts and used bright coloured materials as the shorts became more popular.
According to Jack Lightbourn, former Executive Vice President of the Bank of Bermuda, the general managers of the two banks in Bermuda, [[HSBC Bank Bermuda|The Bank of Bermuda Ltd]] and [[Butterfield Bank|The Bank of N.T. Butterfield and Sons Ltd]]{{Clarify|date=March 2010}} were concerned that their male employees would not have suitable clothing to wear due to clothing shortages related to [[World War II]]. They arranged for a local tailor to make two pairs of shorts, modeled on the shorts of the British military, for each of their male employees. The shorts were made from a very itchy grey flannel material, and each employee was supplied with two pairs of heavy grey wool long socks to wear with the shorts. This was the beginning of Bermuda shorts as business attire in Bermuda as well as the pairing of long socks with Bermuda shorts.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.limeyinbermuda.com/latest_news/2005/08/shorting_the_sh.html |title=A Limey in Bermuda: Shorting the Shorts |access-date=2009-12-08 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091213095500/http://www.limeyinbermuda.com/latest_news/2005/08/shorting_the_sh.html |archive-date=2009-12-13 }}</ref> In the post-war period local merchants such as Trimingham Bros. and H.A. & E. Smiths improved the design of the shorts and used bright coloured materials as the shorts became more popular.


''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'' first used the term "Bermuda shorts" in 1948. The rise in the popularity of the shorts coincides with the broader rise in the acceptability of shorts as daily wear.<ref name="zoe" /> Along with [[Denim jeans|jeans]], Bermuda shorts were prohibited for female students at [[Penn State University]] until 1954, when the ban was lifted only for off-campus events.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Bezilla |first1=Michael |title=Expansion and Its Consequences |url=https://libraries.psu.edu/about/collections/penn-state-university-park-campus-history-collection/penn-state-illustrated-4 |website=PSU.edu |date=15 September 2016 |access-date=3 October 2020}}</ref> A piece from that year in ''[[The New Yorker]]'' mentions that although sales figures for the shorts at retailers such as [[Brooks Brothers]] were increasing, certain hotels and clubs still would not allow them.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Balliett |first1=Whitney |last2=Gill |first2=Brendan |title=Shorts |url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/1954/07/31/shorts |magazine=The New Yorker |access-date=3 October 2020}}</ref> In the spring of 1960, Columbia University president [[Grayson L. Kirk|Grayson Kirk]] complained to the president of [[Barnard College]] that Barnard students were wearing inappropriate clothing. The garments in question were pants and Bermuda shorts. The administration forced the student council to institute a dress code. Students would be allowed to wear shorts and pants only at Barnard and only if the shorts were no more than two inches above the knee and the pants were not tight. Barnard women crossing the street to enter the Columbia campus wearing shorts or pants were required to cover themselves with a long coat.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0A15F73F5916738DDDA10A94DC405B808AF1D3 |title=Ban on Shorts Threatens Classic Barnard Couture |date=April 28, 1960 |work=The New York Times |page=1 |access-date=February 6, 2017 |archive-date=July 31, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220731165451/https://www.nytimes.com/1960/04/28/archives/ban-on-shorts-threatens-classic-barnard-couture-barnard-to-ban.html |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title=Barnard College Blue Book |pages=87–88 |chapter=Administrative Regulations: Campus Etiquette}}</ref>
''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'' first used the term "Bermuda shorts" in 1948. The rise in the popularity of the shorts coincides with the broader rise in the acceptability of shorts as daily wear.<ref name="zoe" /> Along with [[Denim jeans|jeans]], Bermuda shorts were prohibited for female students at [[Penn State University]] until 1954, when the ban was lifted only for off-campus events.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Bezilla |first1=Michael |title=Expansion and Its Consequences |url=https://libraries.psu.edu/about/collections/penn-state-university-park-campus-history-collection/penn-state-illustrated-4 |website=PSU.edu |date=15 September 2016 |access-date=3 October 2020}}</ref> A piece from that year in ''[[The New Yorker]]'' mentions that although sales figures for the shorts at retailers such as [[Brooks Brothers]] were increasing, certain hotels and clubs still would not allow them.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Balliett |first1=Whitney |last2=Gill |first2=Brendan |title=Shorts |url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/1954/07/31/shorts |magazine=The New Yorker |access-date=3 October 2020}}</ref>


Bermuda shorts experienced renewed popularity in the [[1970s in fashion|1970s]] due to increased interest in [[1950s in fashion|the fashion of the 1950s]]. They reappeared on the runways for several years starting in the early 1990s.<ref name="zoe" />
Bermuda shorts experienced renewed popularity in the [[1970s in fashion|1970s]] due to increased interest in [[1950s in fashion|the fashion of the 1950s]]. They reappeared on the runways for several years starting in the early 1990s.<ref name="zoe" />

== Swift India ==

SWIFT India Domestic Services Pvt Ltd (“SWIFT India”) is a privately held company, with shareholders comprising of SWIFT SCRL and a cross section of Indian public and private sector banks.
https://www.swiftindia.org.in/shareholders-and-ownership <!-- Template:Unsigned IP --><small class="autosigned">— Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/120.62.18.44|120.62.18.44]] ([[User talk:120.62.18.44#top|talk]]) 01:03, 9 November 2017 (UTC)</small> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->

== FIN service missing ==
In Section "SWIFTNet network" the FIN service for transporting MT messages is missing. Source: https://www.swift.com/node/13491

== Revenue a secret? ==
I have tried to find information on SWIFT's revenue and which countries contribute which sum/percentages. This may be relevant in the Russian context. If Russia is kicked out, SWIFT fees for others must rise. We have seen it in the context of drugs in sports and the European Council that memberships matter financially as well. We can't ignore that completely, regardless of where we stand. Someone ought to enlighten us what the finances tell us. [[Special:Contributions/2001:8003:A070:7F00:A8D3:56B1:AE6:C195|2001:8003:A070:7F00:A8D3:56B1:AE6:C195]] ([[User talk:2001:8003:A070:7F00:A8D3:56B1:AE6:C195|talk]]) 06:13, 31 December 2021 (UTC)

:'''Comment''' I think that [[SWIFT (organization)]] would also work fine. The full name is just almost never used, which makes it barely recognizable. [[User:PhotographyEdits|PhotographyEdits]] ([[User talk:PhotographyEdits|talk]]) 13:50, 14 February 2022 (UTC)
:'''Comment''' There are 5 criteria for choosing an article title. SWIFT wins hands down for the Recognizability, Naturalness and Concision criteria but fails for Precision criterion due to the programming language of the same name. But if SWIFT vs swift (or Swift) are disambiguated on the relevant pages (e.g., a simple redirect notice) then for the Precision criterion SWIFT could be judged acceptable. I don't know enough to judge on Consistency but I would quote Emerson "A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds." In sum, I agree. I have never heard of the Society's full name and will forget it by tomorrow whereas the whole world now knows about SWIFT, sanctions and all the other s**t. EOR. <!-- Template:Unsigned IP --><small class="autosigned">— Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/2001:14BA:489C:5600:7514:DE4C:8B7A:D026|2001:14BA:489C:5600:7514:DE4C:8B7A:D026]] ([[User talk:2001:14BA:489C:5600:7514:DE4C:8B7A:D026#top|talk]]) 14:28, 21 February 2022 (UTC)</small> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->
<div style="padding-left: 1.6em; font-style: italic; border-top: 1px solid #a2a9b1; margin: 0.5em 0; padding-top: 0.5em">The discussion above is closed. <b style="color: #FF0000;">Please do not modify it.</b> Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page. No further edits should be made to this discussion.</div><!-- from [[Template:Archive bottom]] -->
</div><div style="clear:both;"></div>
== Review " in more than 200 countries and territories" ==
This is a misleading information, there are a maximum of 197 countries in the world. The phrase has the intention of showing grandiosity, clearly a marketing move. <!-- Template:Unsigned IP --><small class="autosigned">— Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/2003:C7:CF12:E46E:5417:DC97:C0DE:8356|2003:C7:CF12:E46E:5417:DC97:C0DE:8356]] ([[User talk:2003:C7:CF12:E46E:5417:DC97:C0DE:8356#top|talk]]) 09:52, 23 March 2021 (UTC)</small> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->

196 if you count Taiwan (ROC); 197 and 198 if you count Niue and The Cook Islands as independent sovereign countries. More if you count countries that are not generally recognised as independent like Abkhazia, Nagorno-Karabakh, Transnistria, etc. Three more if you count the constituent "countries" of the UK as "countries and territories." It's complicated. SWIFT isn't really clear about what it means by this but it's kind of a moot point becasue SWIFT connects banks with banks, not countries with countries. SWIFT bragging about how many countries it does business in is like if the UN bragged about how many continents and regions it includes. Yeah, sure it may be technically relevant but it's not how the system actually works. [[User:Allthenamesarealreadytaken|Allthenamesarealreadytaken]] ([[User talk:Allthenamesarealreadytaken|talk]]) 00:45, 27 February 2022 (UTC)
== Swift format optional fields problem.72 and 53B SBK ==

Does Swift realize issues had occurred prior on mapping of the optional 53B SBK field along with field 52B OBK originating bank. If the transaction on screen does map the field of 53B in a transaction and the next transaction has no 53B and a field 52B it is not refreshed on screen of MTS money transfer system and may trap Pay advise lines on MTS. It was a CSS issue if I remember correctly in BK AUT. [[Special:Contributions/97.118.204.66|97.118.204.66]] ([[User talk:97.118.204.66|talk]]) 20:42, 12 March 2022 (UTC)

'''Kevin Jeffrey Clash''' (born September 17, 1960) is an American puppeteer, director and producer best known for puppeteering [[Elmo]] on ''[[Sesame Street]]'' from 1985 to 2012. He also performed puppets for ''[[Labyrinth (1986 film)|Labyrinth]]'', ''[[Dinosaurs (TV series)|Dinosaurs]]'', ''[[Oobi]]'', and various [[The Muppets|Muppet]] productions.
'''Kevin Jeffrey Clash''' (born September 17, 1960) is an American puppeteer, director and producer best known for puppeteering [[Elmo]] on ''[[Sesame Street]]'' from 1985 to 2012. He also performed puppets for ''[[Labyrinth (1986 film)|Labyrinth]]'', ''[[Dinosaurs (TV series)|Dinosaurs]]'', ''[[Oobi]]'', and various [[The Muppets|Muppet]] productions.


Clash developed an interest in puppetry at an early age and, in his teen years, performed for local television children's shows in his hometown of [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]]. He joined the cast of ''[[Captain Kangaroo]]'' in the early 1980s and began performing on ''Sesame Street'' in 1984. He was the fifth puppeteer to perform Elmo, who became his signature character, and he also served as an executive producer and director for the show. Clash worked in various productions with [[The Jim Henson Company]] and occasionally on other projects. Clash's autobiography, ''My Life as a Furry Red Monster'', was published in 2006; he was later the subject of the documentary ''[[Being Elmo: A Puppeteer's Journey]]'' (2011).
Clash developed an interest in puppetry at an early age and, in his teen years, performed for local television children's shows in his hometown of [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]].He is honored a lot dude. He joined the cast of ''[[Captain Kangaroo]]'' in the early 1980s and began performing on ''Sesame Street'' in 1984. He was the fifth puppeteer to perform Elmo, who became his signature character, and he also served as an executive producer and director for the show. Clash worked in various productions with [[The Jim Henson Company]] and occasionally on other projects. Clash's autobiography, ''My Life as a Furry Red Monster'', was published in 2006; he was later the subject of the documentary ''[[Being Elmo: A Puppeteer's Journey]]'' (2011).


Clash resigned from ''Sesame Street'' in 2012 after allegations of sexual impropriety with minors, all of which he denied and were later dismissed due to expiration of the [[statute of limitations]]. Clash returned to puppeteering as a supporting performer in the adult comedy ''[[The Happytime Murders]]'' (2018).

[[WP:BLP]] of a writer, not [[WP:RS|properly sourced]] as having any strong claim to passing [[WP:NAUTHOR]]. As always, writers are not automatically notable enough for Wikipedia articles just because their work exists, and have to be shown to pass [[WP:GNG]] on third-party reliable source coverage ''about'' them and their work -- but of the seven footnotes that were in this article when I first saw it, three were just her own writing being cited as metaverification of itself (which does not help to establish a writer's notability at all), so I've stripped those.<br>And of the four footnotes remaining, one is a brief glancing namecheck of her existence in a very short news brief that isn't about her in any non-trivial sense; one is a brief Q&A [[WP:INTERVIEWS|interview]] in a [[WP:BLOGS|blog]] in which she's asked just two questions (of which one is about her downtime hobby of fencing rather than her career); and one completely fails to name the publication that the citation came from, and also identifies the individual author solely by first name rather than surname, so it's completely unretrievable for the purposes of establishing whether it's a reliable and notability-building source or not.<br>And while there's ''one'' source left (The Presbyterian Record) that I haven't been able to assess for how substantive it is or isn't, one footnote wouldn't be enough to pass GNG all by itself.<br>Nothing here is "inherently" notable enough to exempt her from needing much, much better sourcing than this. [[User:Bearcat|Bearcat]] ([[User talk:Bearcat|talk]]) 14:26, 6 February 2026 (UTC)
[[WP:BLP]] of a writer, not [[WP:RS|properly sourced]] as having any strong claim to passing [[WP:NAUTHOR]]. As always, writers are not automatically notable enough for Wikipedia articles just because their work exists, and have to be shown to pass [[WP:GNG]] on third-party reliable source coverage ''about'' them and their work -- but of the seven footnotes that were in this article when I first saw it, three were just her own writing being cited as metaverification of itself (which does not help to establish a writer's notability at all), so I've stripped those.<br>And of the four footnotes remaining, one is a brief glancing namecheck of her existence in a less-than-100-word news brief that isn't about her in any non-trivial sense; one is a brief Q&A [[WP:INTERVIEWS|interview]] in a [[WP:BLOGS|blog]] in which she's asked just two questions (of which one is about her downtime hobby of fencing rather than her career); and one completely fails to name the publication that the citation came from, and also identifies the individual author solely by first name rather than surname, so it's completely unretrievable for the purposes of establishing whether it's a reliable and notability-building source or not.<br>And while there's ''one'' source left (The Presbyterian Record) that I haven't been able to assess for how substantive it is or isn't, one footnote wouldn't be enough to pass GNG all by itself.<br>Nothing here is "inherently" notable enough to exempt her from needing much, much better sourcing than this. [[User:Bearcat|Bearcat]] ([[User talk:Bearcat|talk]]) 14:26, 6 February 2026 (UTC)

==Career==
==Career==


Revealed by the youth sectors of Ceará, Cristiano was part of the champion squads of the Copa do Nordeste and the Brazilian Under-23 Championship in 2020.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://ge.globo.com/ce/futebol/noticia/ceara-vence-vila-nova-nos-penaltis-e-conquista-o-brasileirao-de-aspirantes.ghtml |title=Ceará vence Vila Nova nos pênaltis e conquista o Brasileirão de Aspirantes |website=GloboEsporte |date=31 January 2021 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=14 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210914112534/https://ge.globo.com/ce/futebol/noticia/ceara-vence-vila-nova-nos-penaltis-e-conquista-o-brasileirao-de-aspirantes.ghtml |url-status=live }}</ref> Without getting much space, he was later loaned to EC São José, where he stood out as the team's top scorer. He was traded to Iwate Grulla Morioka where he played for two seasons,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.uol.com.br/esporte/ultimas-noticias/enm/2022/07/04/revelado-pelo-ceara-cristiano-acerta-com-o-futebol-japones.htm |title=Revelado pelo Ceará, Cristiano acerta com o futebol japonês |website=UOL Esporte |date=4 July 2022 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=7 November 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20251107005831/https://www.uol.com.br/esporte/ultimas-noticias/enm/2022/07/04/revelado-pelo-ceara-cristiano-acerta-com-o-futebol-japones.htm |url-status=live}}</ref> returning to Brazil in 2024 to defend Volta Redonda.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/01/23/volta-redonda-anuncia-a-contratacao-do-atacante-cristiano-que-estava-no-futebol-japones.ghtml |title=Volta Redonda anuncia a contratação do atacante Cristiano, que estava no futebol japonês |website=GloboEsporte |date=23 January 2024 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=4 February 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240204164653/https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/01/23/volta-redonda-anuncia-a-contratacao-do-atacante-cristiano-que-estava-no-futebol-japones.ghtml |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/02/05/italo-macario-ou-cristiano-equilibrio-acirra-disputa-por-vaga-no-ataque-do-volta-redonda.ghtml |title=Ítalo, Macário ou Cristiano? Equilíbrio acirra disputa por vaga no ataque do Volta Redonda |website=GloboEsporte |date=5 February 2024 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=8 February 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240208183616/https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/02/05/italo-macario-ou-cristiano-equilibrio-acirra-disputa-por-vaga-no-ataque-do-volta-redonda.ghtml |url-status=live }}</ref> For the 2025 season, Cristiano signed with Ypiranga de [[Erechim]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.peleiafc.com/post/ypiranga-contrata-atacante-campe%C3%A3o-da-s%C3%A9rie-c |title=Ypiranga contrata atacante campeão da Série C |website=Peleia FC |date=27 December 2024 |access-date=25 January 2025 |language=pt |archive-date=18 March 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250318134750/https://www.peleiafc.com/post/ypiranga-contrata-atacante-campe%C3%A3o-da-s%C3%A9rie-c |url-status=live }}</ref> On September, Cristiano terminated his contract and signed with EC Pelotas.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://ahoradosul.com.br/conteudos/2025/09/09/acertado-com-o-pelotas-cristiano-se-aproxima-de-rescisao-com-o-ypiranga/ |title=Acertado com o Pelotas, Cristiano se aproxima de rescisão com o Ypiranga |website=A Hora do Sul |date=9 September 2025 |language=pt |archive-date=6 November 2025 |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20251106174957/https://ahoradosul.com.br/conteudos/2025/09/09/acertado-com-o-pelotas-cristiano-se-aproxima-de-rescisao-com-o-ypiranga/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
Revealed by the youth sectors of Ceará, Cristiano was part of the champion squads of the Copa do Nordeste and the Brazilian Under-23 Championship in 2020.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://ge.globo.com/ce/futebol/noticia/ceara-vence-vila-nova-nos-penaltis-e-conquista-o-brasileirao-de-aspirantes.ghtml |title=Ceará vence Vila Nova nos pênaltis e conquista o Brasileirão de Aspirantes |website=GloboEsporte |date=31 January 2021 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=14 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210914112534/https://ge.globo.com/ce/futebol/noticia/ceara-vence-vila-nova-nos-penaltis-e-conquista-o-brasileirao-de-aspirantes.ghtml |url-status=live }}</ref> Without getting much space, he was later loaned to EC São José, where he stood out as the team's top scorer. He was traded to Iwate Grulla Morioka where he played for two seasons,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.uol.com.br/esporte/ultimas-noticias/enm/2022/07/04/revelado-pelo-ceara-cristiano-acerta-com-o-futebol-japones.htm |title=Revelado pelo Ceará, Cristiano acerta com o futebol japonês |website=UOL Esporte |date=4 July 2022 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=7 November 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20251107005831/https://www.uol.com.br/esporte/ultimas-noticias/enm/2022/07/04/revelado-pelo-ceara-cristiano-acerta-com-o-futebol-japones.htm |url-status=live}}</ref> returning to Brazil in 2024 to defend Volta Redonda.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/01/23/volta-redonda-anuncia-a-contratacao-do-atacante-cristiano-que-estava-no-futebol-japones.ghtml |title=Volta Redonda anuncia a contratação do atacante Cristiano, que estava no futebol japonês |website=GloboEsporte |date=23 January 2024 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=4 February 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240204164653/https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/01/23/volta-redonda-anuncia-a-contratacao-do-atacante-cristiano-que-estava-no-futebol-japones.ghtml |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/02/05/italo-macario-ou-cristiano-equilibrio-acirra-disputa-por-vaga-no-ataque-do-volta-redonda.ghtml |title=Ítalo, Macário ou Cristiano? Equilíbrio acirra disputa por vaga no ataque do Volta Redonda |website=GloboEsporte |date=5 February 2024 |access-date=10 October 2024 |language=pt |archive-date=8 February 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240208183616/https://ge.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/futebol/noticia/2024/02/05/italo-macario-ou-cristiano-equilibrio-acirra-disputa-por-vaga-no-ataque-do-volta-redonda.ghtml |url-status=live }}</ref> For the 2025 season, Cristiano signed with Ypiranga de [[Erechim]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.peleiafc.com/post/ypiranga-contrata-atacante-campe%C3%A3o-da-s%C3%A9rie-c |title=Ypiranga contrata atacante campeão da Série C |website=Peleia FC |date=27 December 2024 |access-date=25 January 2025 |language=pt |archive-date=18 March 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250318134750/https://www.peleiafc.com/post/ypiranga-contrata-atacante-campe%C3%A3o-da-s%C3%A9rie-c |url-status=live }}</ref> On September, Cristiano terminated his contract and signed with EC Pelotas.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://ahoradosul.com.br/conteudos/2025/09/09/acertado-com-o-pelotas-cristiano-se-aproxima-de-rescisao-com-o-ypiranga/ |title=Acertado com o Pelotas, Cristiano se aproxima de rescisão com o Ypiranga |website=A Hora do Sul |date=9 September 2025 |language=pt |archive-date=6 November 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20251106174957/https://ahoradosul.com.br/conteudos/2025/09/09/acertado-com-o-pelotas-cristiano-se-aproxima-de-rescisao-com-o-ypiranga/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Critical Reception: spelling correction

← Previous revision Revision as of 14:27, 6 February 2026
Line 56: Line 56:
In 1999, ''Up-helly-aa: Custom, Culture and Community in [[Shetland]]'' won the Frank Watson Prize for best book or monograph published on Scottish History.<ref>{{Cite web |date=7 January 2026 |title=Frank Watson Book Prize |url=https://www.uoguelph.ca/arts/scottish/frank-watson-book-prize}}</ref>
In 1999, ''Up-helly-aa: Custom, Culture and Community in [[Shetland]]'' won the Frank Watson Prize for best book or monograph published on Scottish History.<ref>{{Cite web |date=7 January 2026 |title=Frank Watson Book Prize |url=https://www.uoguelph.ca/arts/scottish/frank-watson-book-prize}}</ref>


Hugh McLeod, writing in ''Social History'', praised ''Becoming Atheist: Humanism and the Secular West'', which appeared in 2017, for its innovative uses of oral history, saying that the ‘originality of Brown’s account lies not only in the highly detailed tracing of individual life stories, but also in showing patterns of similarity between accounts by those of the same nationality, ethnicity, gender or religious background.’ McLeod found Callum Brown’s analysis of the impact of different ethnic or religious backgrounds upon journeys to humanism, such as those of [[African Americans]] and [[Jewish secularism|secular Jews]] to be ‘especially interesting.’<ref name=":1">{{Cite journal |last=Mcleod |first=Hugh |date=19 December 2017 |title=Review: Becoming Atheist: Humanism and the Secular West |url=https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/03071022.2017.1397373 |journal=Social History |volume=43 |issue=1 |pages=142-144 |via=Taylor and Francis}}</ref> McLeod did however, offfer some reservations, chiefly, that the book canvased the memories of members of humanist organisations, a small group, rather than a 'random sample of atheists.' They were, he asserted, a 'distinctive group', mostly 'elderly, many well-educated and containing no less than ten-percent former clergy or trainee clergy.' McLeod was also doubtful about the primacy in a book about 'the West' of the emphasis on the 1960s as a moment of religious rupture in Britain, which 'would have been impossible if he was writing about Germany or France.' While Brown had 'been successful in showing how committed humanists saw the world', McLeod said, there remained room for a 'more detached analysis.'<ref name=":1" /> [[Edward Royle]], in the ''[[The Journal of Ecclesiastical History|Journal of Ecclesiastical History]]'', found the book a 'carefully researched and closely argued study, written from an atheist point of view' which 'should provoke religious historians to re-examine their assumptions about how the process of secularisation should be understood in the contemporary world.'<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Royle |first=Edward |date=October 2017 |title=Review: Becoming Athiest: Humanism and the Secular West |url=https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/journal-of-ecclesiastical-history/article/becoming-atheist-humanism-and-the-secular-west-by-callum-g-brown-pp-x-231-incl-3-tables-londonnew-york-bloomsbury-2017-2199-paper-978-1-4742-2452-9/A2AD5EBB6D1B54166C0151EF81E1F1B3 |journal=Journal of Ecclesiastical History |volume=68 |issue=4 |pages=911-913 |via=Cambridge Core}}</ref>
Hugh McLeod, writing in ''Social History'', praised ''Becoming Atheist: Humanism and the Secular West'', which appeared in 2017, for its innovative uses of oral history, saying that the ‘originality of Brown’s account lies not only in the highly detailed tracing of individual life stories, but also in showing patterns of similarity between accounts by those of the same nationality, ethnicity, gender or religious background.’ McLeod found Callum Brown’s analysis of the impact of different ethnic or religious backgrounds upon journeys to humanism, such as those of [[African Americans]] and [[Jewish secularism|secular Jews]] to be ‘especially interesting.’<ref name=":1">{{Cite journal |last=Mcleod |first=Hugh |date=19 December 2017 |title=Review: Becoming Atheist: Humanism and the Secular West |url=https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/03071022.2017.1397373 |journal=Social History |volume=43 |issue=1 |pages=142-144 |via=Taylor and Francis}}</ref> McLeod did however, offer some reservations, chiefly, that the book canvased the memories of members of humanist organisations, a small group, rather than a 'random sample of atheists.' They were, he asserted, a 'distinctive group', mostly 'elderly, many well-educated and containing no less than ten-percent former clergy or trainee clergy.' McLeod was also doubtful about the primacy in a book about 'the West' of the emphasis on the 1960s as a moment of religious rupture in Britain, which 'would have been impossible if he was writing about Germany or France.' While Brown had 'been successful in showing how committed humanists saw the world', McLeod said, there remained room for a 'more detached analysis.'<ref name=":1" /> [[Edward Royle]], in the ''[[The Journal of Ecclesiastical History|Journal of Ecclesiastical History]]'', found the book a 'carefully researched and closely argued study, written from an atheist point of view' which 'should provoke religious historians to re-examine their assumptions about how the process of secularisation should be understood in the contemporary world.'<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Royle |first=Edward |date=October 2017 |title=Review: Becoming Athiest: Humanism and the Secular West |url=https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/journal-of-ecclesiastical-history/article/becoming-atheist-humanism-and-the-secular-west-by-callum-g-brown-pp-x-231-incl-3-tables-londonnew-york-bloomsbury-2017-2199-paper-978-1-4742-2452-9/A2AD5EBB6D1B54166C0151EF81E1F1B3 |journal=Journal of Ecclesiastical History |volume=68 |issue=4 |pages=911-913 |via=Cambridge Core}}</ref>


''Religion and the Demographic Revolution'' was appraised by Todd Green, reviewer for [[Church History (journal)|''Church History'']], to have ‘delivered a persuasive argument for connections between demography, religion and secularisation. The sheer range of data he [Brown] draws on makes his case impressive.’ Given the ‘neglect of gender in traditional accounts of religious change and decline in modern histories of the West, Green felt that ‘Brown’s book is an indispensable contribution to the field’ which would ‘go a long way to helping bring gender as a crucial category of analysis from the periphery to the centre of the secularisation debate.’<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Green |first=Todd |date=7 March 2014 |title=Review: Religion and the Demographic Revolution: Women and Secularisation in Canada, Ireland, UK and USA since the 1960s. |url=https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/church-history/article/religion-and-the-demographic-revolution-women-and-secularisation-in-canada-ireland-uk-and-usa-since-the-1960s-by-callum-g-brown-studies-in-modern-british-religious-history-29-woodbridge-uk-boydell-2012-xiv-305-pp-9500-cloth/75247688E401122DA56350D7EEF892EB |journal=Church History |volume=83 |issue=1 |pages=258-260 |via=Cambridge Core}}</ref> S.C Williams, for the ''[[The English Historical Review|English Historical Review]]'', considered ''Religion and the Demographic Revolution'' to be a ‘fascinating analysis’ which brought together and studied the bonds between ‘three powerful revolutions: the secular, the demographic and the revolution in women’s identities.’ He was more critical of the book’s treatment of the demographic growth of ‘other religionists’, whose mass immigration from regions with faith traditions other than Christianity ‘had become a vital characteristic of each of the countries studied.’ However, Williams concluded it ‘remained the case that Brown had produced a watershed book which opened new ground in the social history of religion.’<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Williams |first=S.C |date=18 January 2016 |title=Review: Religion and the Demographic Revolution: Women and Secularisation in Canada, Ireland, UK and USA since the 1960s, by Callum G. Brown. |url=https://academic.oup.com/ehr/article/130/547/1616/2450190?login=true |journal=English Historical Review |volume=130 |issue=547 |pages=1616-1618 |via=Oxford Academic}}</ref>

Brown. |url=https://academic.oup.com/ehr/article/130/547/1616/2450190?login=true |journal=English Historical Review |volume=130 |issue=547 |pages=1616-1618 |via=Oxford Academic}}</ref>

← Previous revision Revision as of 14:27, 6 February 2026

* "Deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part".<ref name="reliefweb.int-2024"/>{{rp|at=paragraphs 34–45}}
Albanese called for [[List of sanctions involving Israel|sanctions]] and an [[Arms embargoes on Israel since 2023|arms embargo]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Farge |first=Emma |date=26 March 2024 |title=UN expert says Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, calls for arms embargo |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/un-expert-says-israel-has-committed-genocide-gaza-calls-arms-embargo-2024-03-26/ |work=[[Reuters]] |archive-date=6 May 2024 |access-date=27 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240506133722/https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/un-expert-says-israel-has-committed-genocide-gaza-calls-arms-embargo-2024-03-26/ |url-status=live}}</ref> She was one of the many UN experts who spoke out against the sale of arms to Israel in June 2024 to be used in the [[conflict in Gaza]]. The experts cautioned arms suppliers and finance companies that they would be implicated in human rights violations. The signatories to the warning included special reporteurs [[Paula Gaviria Betancur]], [[Tlaleng Mofokeng]] and [[Margaret Satterthwaite]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=20 June 2024 |title=States and companies must end arms transfers to Israel immediately or risk responsibility for human rights violations: UN experts |url=https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2024/06/states-and-companies-must-end-arms-transfers-israel-immediately-or-risk |publisher=[[United Nations]] |access-date=25 June 2024 |archive-date=8 January 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250108100305/https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2024/06/states-and-companies-must-end-arms-transfers-israel-immediately-or-risk |url-status=live}}</ref> Furthermore, she points to the settler colonial context of genocidal practices resulting in "destruction and replacement of Indigenous peoples"<ref name="reliefweb.int-2024" />{{rp|at=paragraph 9}} and recommends the "reconstitution of the [[United Nations Special Committee against Apartheid]]" to address the situation in Palestine.<ref name="reliefweb.int-2024" />{{rp|at=paragraph 97e}}
Albanese called for [[List of sanctions involving Israel|sanctions]] and an [[Arms embargoes on Israel since 2023|arms embargo]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Farge |first=Emma |date=26 March 2024 |title=UN expert says Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, calls for arms embargo |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/un-expert-says-israel-has-committed-genocide-gaza-calls-arms-embargo-2024-03-26/ |work=[[Reuters]] |archive-date=6 May 2024 |access-date=27 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240506133722/https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/un-expert-says-israel-has-committed-genocide-gaza-calls-arms-embargo-2024-03-26/ |url-status=live}}</ref> She was one of the many UN experts who spoke out against the sale of arms to Israel in June 2024 to be used in the [[conflict in Gaza]]. The experts cautioned arms suppliers and finance companies that they would be implicated in human rights violations. The signatories to the warning included special reporteurs [[Paula Gaviria Betancur]], [[Tlaleng Mofokeng]], and [[Margaret Satterthwaite]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=20 June 2024 |title=States and companies must end arms transfers to Israel immediately or risk responsibility for human rights violations: UN experts |url=https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2024/06/states-and-companies-must-end-arms-transfers-israel-immediately-or-risk |publisher=[[United Nations]] |access-date=25 June 2024 |archive-date=8 January 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250108100305/https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2024/06/states-and-companies-must-end-arms-transfers-israel-immediately-or-risk |url-status=live}}</ref> Furthermore, she points to the settler colonial context of genocidal practices resulting in "destruction and replacement of Indigenous peoples",<ref name="reliefweb.int-2024" />{{rp|at=paragraph 9}} and recommends the "reconstitution of the [[United Nations Special Committee against Apartheid]]" to address the situation in Palestine.<ref name="reliefweb.int-2024" />{{rp|at=paragraph 97e}}


[[File:Conferencia emergencia Palestina-Joel González 21.jpg|thumb|Albanese, Palestinian diplomat [[Riyad Mansour]], and Colombian President [[Gustavo Petro]] at the [[Emergency Conference on Palestine]] in Bogota, Colombia, 16 July 2025]]
[[File:Conferencia emergencia Palestina-Joel González 21.jpg|thumb|Albanese, Palestinian diplomat [[Riyad Mansour]], and Colombian President [[Gustavo Petro]] at the [[Emergency Conference on Palestine]] in Bogota, Colombia, 16 July 2025]]
During a briefing on the international legal responsibilities for preventing genocide, Albanese said that, given the way Israel is currently behaving, it is time to consider suspending their credential as a Member State, under Article 6 of the Charter of the United Nations".<ref>{{Cite press release |date=31 October 2024 |title='It Is Important to Call a Genocide a Genocide,' Consider Suspending Israel's Credential as UN Member State, Experts Tell Palestinian Rights Committee |url=https://press.un.org/en/2024/gapal1473.doc.htm |publisher=[[United Nations]] |access-date=1 November 2024 |archive-date=5 November 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241105122046/https://press.un.org/en/2024/gapal1473.doc.htm |url-status=live}}</ref> In an interview with the [[Middle East Eye]] in November 2024, Albanese described [[Foreign Secretary (United Kingdom)|Foreign Secretary]] of the United Kingdom [[David Lammy]] as a [[genocide denier]], and stated that the British government had done nothing to prevent Israel's [[Atrocity crime|atrocities]] in Gaza.<ref>{{cite news |title=UN Special Rapporteur Francesca Albanese calls David Lammy a 'genocide denier' |url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/un-special-rapporteur-francesca-albanese-calls-david-lammy-genocide-denier |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250903114357/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/un-special-rapporteur-francesca-albanese-calls-david-lammy-genocide-denier |work=[[Middle East Eye]] |date=14 November 2024 |first1=Sondos |last1=Asem |first2=Imran |last2=Mulla |access-date=3 September 2025 |archive-date=3 September 2025}}</ref> In March 2025, [[Betar]], a Jewish far-right organization, threatened Albanese with a pager attack during her visit to [[London]]. The group posted a statement on [[Twitter]] that said "Join us to give Francesca a [pager emoji] in London on Tuesday."<ref name="Osman 2025">{{cite news |title=Who are Betar, the ultra-Zionists threatening Francesca Albanese? |url=https://www.newarab.com/news/who-betar-ultra-zionists-threatening-francesca-albanese |work=[[The New Arab]] |first=Nadda |last=Osman |date=17 March 2025 |access-date=17 March 2025 |archive-date=17 March 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250317172507/https://www.newarab.com/news/who-betar-ultra-zionists-threatening-francesca-albanese |url-status=live}}</ref> The pager emoji is a reference to the [[2024 Lebanon electronic device attacks|2024 pager attacks in Lebanon]].<ref name="Osman 2025"/> Albanese said that she and her family had received death threats.<ref name="Dedorson-2025" />
During a briefing on the international legal responsibilities for preventing genocide, Albanese said that given the way Israel was behaving, it was time to consider suspending their credential as a member state under Article 6 of the UN Charter.<ref>{{Cite press release |date=31 October 2024 |title='It Is Important to Call a Genocide a Genocide,' Consider Suspending Israel's Credential as UN Member State, Experts Tell Palestinian Rights Committee |url=https://press.un.org/en/2024/gapal1473.doc.htm |publisher=[[United Nations]] |access-date=1 November 2024 |archive-date=5 November 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241105122046/https://press.un.org/en/2024/gapal1473.doc.htm |url-status=live}}</ref> In an interview with the [[Middle East Eye]] in November 2024, Albanese described [[Foreign Secretary (United Kingdom)|Foreign Secretary]] of the United Kingdom [[David Lammy]] as a [[genocide denier]], and stated that the British government had done nothing to prevent Israel's [[Atrocity crime|atrocities]] in Gaza.<ref>{{cite news |title=UN Special Rapporteur Francesca Albanese calls David Lammy a 'genocide denier' |url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/un-special-rapporteur-francesca-albanese-calls-david-lammy-genocide-denier |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250903114357/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/un-special-rapporteur-francesca-albanese-calls-david-lammy-genocide-denier |work=[[Middle East Eye]] |date=14 November 2024 |first1=Sondos |last1=Asem |first2=Imran |last2=Mulla |access-date=3 September 2025 |archive-date=3 September 2025}}</ref> In March 2025, [[Betar]], a Jewish far-right organization, threatened Albanese with a pager attack during her visit to [[London]]. The group posted a statement on [[Twitter]] that said "Join us to give Francesca a [pager emoji] in London on Tuesday."<ref name="Osman 2025">{{cite news |title=Who are Betar, the ultra-Zionists threatening Francesca Albanese? |url=https://www.newarab.com/news/who-betar-ultra-zionists-threatening-francesca-albanese |work=[[The New Arab]] |first=Nadda |last=Osman |date=17 March 2025 |access-date=17 March 2025 |archive-date=17 March 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250317172507/https://www.newarab.com/news/who-betar-ultra-zionists-threatening-francesca-albanese |url-status=live}}</ref> The pager emoji is a reference to the [[2024 Lebanon electronic device attacks|2024 pager attacks in Lebanon]].<ref name="Osman 2025"/> Albanese said that she and her family had received death threats.<ref name="Dedorson-2025" />


Albanese criticized the Trump administration for welcoming Israeli Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] to the United States and maintaining friendly relations with him, despite the fact that an [[International Criminal Court arrest warrants for Israeli leaders|arrest warrant]] has been issued for Netanyahu by the [[International Criminal Court investigation in Palestine|International Criminal Court]] (ICC).<ref>{{cite news |title=UN Palestine investigator Albanese slams US sanctions on her as 'a sign of guilt' |url=https://www.euronews.com/2025/07/11/un-palestine-investigator-albanese-slams-us-sanctions-on-her-as-a-sign-of-guilt |work=[[Euronews]] |date=11 July 2025 |archive-date=25 July 2025 |access-date=2 September 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250725034417/https://www.euronews.com/2025/07/11/un-palestine-investigator-albanese-slams-us-sanctions-on-her-as-a-sign-of-guilt
